page.title: 15Social Concern
page.content: In the middle of Cardross there are a few old beautiful trees, on which there is a preservation order. Recently 2 trees were cut down without permission by the regional council to create a bus bay. These trees took over a hundred years to grow so the council now have to plant 2 more on the insistance of Cardross Community Council. Geilston House was built as a gift to Cardross village from the Burns family. They also left money in trust to maintain the hall. Peolple could only give donations for the use of the hall. As a result of massive inflation all the money has been used. The Community Council are now taking over the hall with the District Council's help to make it a community centre.
